https://github.com/yannbertrand/macos-de.name: Dock
https://github.com/yannbertrand/macos-de.description:
The Dock is a prominent feature of macOS.
It is used to launch applications and to switch between running applications.
By default you can find it on the bottom of your screen.

You can customize it as you like.

keys.title: Position
keys.description: Set the Dock position

keys.title: Icon size
keys.description: Set the icon size of Dock items in pixels.

keys.title: Autohide
keys.description: Autohides the Dock. You can toggle the Dock using `⌥ alt`+`⌘ cmd`+`d`.

keys.title: Autohide animation time
keys.description: Change the Dock opening and closing animation times.

keys.title: Autohide delay
keys.description: Change the Dock opening delay.

keys.title: Show recents
keys.description: Show recently used apps in a separate section of the Dock.

keys.title: Minimize animation effect
keys.description: Change the Dock minimize animation.

https://github.com/yannbertrand/macos-de.name: Screenshots
https://github.com/yannbertrand/macos-de.description:
On a Mac, you can take screenshots using:

- `⌘ cmd`+`⇧ shift`+`3` for fullscreen.
- `⌘ cmd`+`⇧ shift`+`4` for a selection. Then use `space` to capture an entire app.
- `⌘ cmd`+`⇧ shift`+`5` to open the Screenshot app.

There are a few keys you can customize.

keys.title: Disable shadow
keys.description: Disable screenshot shadow when capturing an app (`⌘ cmd`+`⇧ shift`+`4` then `space`).

keys.title: Include date
keys.description: Include date and time in screenshot filenames.

keys.title: Set location
keys.description: Set default screenshot location.

keys.title: Display thumbnail
keys.description: Choose whether to display a thumbnail after taking a screenshot.

keys.title: Choose screenshot format
keys.description: Choose the screenshots image format.

https://github.com/yannbertrand/macos-de.name: Finder
https://github.com/yannbertrand/macos-de.description:
The Finder is the default file manager on macOS.
It is responsible for the launching of other applications,
and for the overall user management of files, disks, and network volumes.
In a tradition dating back to the Classic Mac OS of the 1980s and 1990s,
the Finder icon is the smiling screen of a computer, known as the Happy Mac logo.

Some of its features can be customized.

keys.title: Quit
keys.description: Add a quit option to the Finder.

keys.title: Show extensions
keys.description: Show all file extensions in the Finder.

keys.title: Show hidden files
keys.description: Show hidden files in the Finder. You can toggle the value using `⌘ cmd`+`⇧ shift`+`.`.

keys.title: Changing file extension warning
keys.description: Choose whether to display a warning when changing a file extension.

keys.title: Save to disk or iCloud by default
keys.description: Choose whether the default file save location is on disk or iCloud

keys.title: Adjust toolbar title rollover delay
keys.description: Choose the delay of the auto-hidden document-proxy icon.

keys.title: Set sidebar icon size
keys.description: Choose the size of Finder sidebar icons

https://github.com/yannbertrand/macos-de.name: Menu Bar
https://github.com/yannbertrand/macos-de.description: The menu bar runs along the top of the screen on your Mac. Use the menus and icons in the menu bar to choose commands, perform tasks, and check status.

keys.title: Flash clock time separators
keys.description: When enabled, the clock indicator (which by default is the colon) will flash on and off each second.

keys.title: Set menubar digital clock format
keys.description:
This setting configures the time and date format for the menubar digital clock.
Accepted values depend on your Language & Region settings.

- `ss` for seconds.
- `HH` for 24-hour clock.
- `EEE` for 3-letter day of the week.
- `d MMM` for day of the month and 3-letter month.

https://github.com/yannbertrand/macos-de.name: Mission Control
https://github.com/yannbertrand/macos-de.description:
Formerly known as Spaces, Mission Control allows a user to do the following:

- `⌃ ctrl`+`↑ up` view all open application windows.
- `⌃ ctrl`+`↓ down` view all open application windows of a specific application.
- `⌘ cmd`+`F3 Mission Control` hide all application windows and show the desktop.
- `⌃ ctrl`+`← left`/`→ right` manage application windows across multiple virtual desktops.
- manage application windows across multiple monitors.

keys.title: Rearrange automatically
keys.description: Choose whether to rearrange Spaces automatically.

https://github.com/yannbertrand/macos-de.name: Feedback Assistant
https://github.com/yannbertrand/macos-de.description: The Feedback Assistant app allows user to submit reports for developer or public betas.

keys.title: Autogather
keys.description:
Choose whether to autogather large files when submitting a feedback report.

Can result in a slow Mac and important upload metrics.

https://github.com/yannbertrand/macos-de.name: Xcode
https://github.com/yannbertrand/macos-de.description: Xcode is an integrated development environment for macOS containing a suite of software development tools developed by Apple for developing software for macOS, iOS, iPadOS, watchOS, and tvOS.

keys.title: Add Additional Counterpart Suffixes
keys.description: Add additional counterpart suffixes that Xcode should consider in the "Related Items > Counterparts" menu.

keys.title: Show Build Durations
keys.description: Show build durations in the Activity Viewer in Xcode's toolbar at the top of the workspace window.

https://github.com/yannbertrand/macos-de.name: Simulator
https://github.com/yannbertrand/macos-de.description: Installed as part of the Xcode tools, Simulator is a Mac app simulating iPhone, iPad, Apple Watch, or Apple TV environments.

keys.title: Set screenshot location
keys.description:
Set default location for Simulator screenshots.

Note that the folder has to exist in the filesystem.

https://github.com/yannbertrand/macos-de.name: TextEdit
https://github.com/yannbertrand/macos-de.description: TextEdit allows you to open and edit rich text, plain text and HTML documents.

keys.title: Set default document format
keys.description: Set default document format as rich text (.rtf) or plain text (.txt).

https://github.com/yannbertrand/macos-de.name: Time Machine
https://github.com/yannbertrand/macos-de.description: The Time Machine feature allows simple, regular backups of your filesystem.

keys.title: Don't offer new disks for Time Machine backup
keys.description: Prevent Time Machine from prompting to use newly connected storage as backup volumes.

https://github.com/yannbertrand/macos-de.name: Miscellaneous
https://github.com/yannbertrand/macos-de.description: All the others `defaults` that don't deserve their own category.

keys.title: Help Menu position
keys.description: Choose whether the Help Menu should be always-on-top.

keys.title: Enable spring loading for all Dock items
keys.description: Drag a file over an icon in the Dock, hover, and the application will open. The behaviour is unchanged if the app is already open. This behaviour has been observed with Preview, Quicktime, and iWork (Keynote, Pages, Numbers).

keys.title: Show Music song notifications
keys.description: Display a notification when a new song starts in the Music app.

keys.title: Disable application quarantine message
keys.description:
Turn off the “Application Downloaded from Internet” quarantine warning.

⚠️ Stopped working on Big Sur.

keys.title: reduceTransparency
keys.description: Disable transparency in the menu bar and elsewhere on Yosemite.

keys.title: AppleHighlightColor
keys.description: Set highlight color to

keys.title: AppleShowScrollBars
keys.description: When to show scrollbars. Choices: WhenScrolling (When scrolling), Automatic (Automatic), Always (Always)

keys.title: NSUseAnimatedFocusRing
keys.description: Disable the over-the-top focus ring animation.

keys.title: NSScrollAnimationEnabled
keys.description: Disable smooth scrolling. Uncomment if you’re on an older Mac that messes up the animation.

keys.title: NSWindowResizeTime
keys.description: Increase window resize speed for Cocoa applications.

keys.title: NSNavPanelExpandedStateForSaveMode
keys.description: Expand save panel by default.

keys.title: NSNavPanelExpandedStateForSaveMode
keys.description: Expand save panel by default.

keys.title: PMPrintingExpandedStateForPrint
keys.description: Expand print panel by default.

keys.title: PMPrintingExpandedStateForPrint
keys.description: Expand print panel by default.

keys.title: PrintingPrefsQuitWhenFinished
keys.description: Automatically quit printer app once the print jobs complete.

keys.title: NSTextShowsControlCharacters
keys.description:
Display ASCII control characters using caret notation in standard text views. Try e.g.
cd /tmp; unidecode "\x{0000}" > cc.txt; open -e cc.txt

keys.title: NSQuitAlwaysKeepsWindows
keys.description: Disable Resume system-wide.

keys.title: NSDisableAutomaticTermination
keys.description: Disable automatic termination of inactive apps.

keys.title: CrashReporterDialogTypeNone
keys.description: Disable the crash reporter.

keys.title: AdminHostInfo
keys.description: Reveal IP address, hostname, OS version, etc. when clicking the clock in the login window.

keys.title: NSAutomaticCapitalizationEnabled
keys.description: Disable automatic capitalization as it's annoying when typing code.

keys.title: NSAutomaticDashSubstitutionEnabled
keys.description: Disable smart dashes as they’re annoying when typing code.

keys.title: NSAutomaticPeriodSubstitutionEnabled
keys.description: Disable automatic period substitution as it’s annoying when typing code.

keys.title: NSAutomaticQuoteSubstitutionEnabled
keys.description: Disable smart quotes as they’re annoying when typing code.

keys.title: NSAutomaticSpellingCorrectionEnabled
keys.description: Disable auto-correct.

keys.description: Require password immediately after sleep or screen saver begins.

keys.title: askForPassword

keys.title: DisplayResolutionEnabled

keys.title: DisableAllAnimations

keys.title: newFinderLocation

keys.description: Automatically open a new Finder window when a volume is mounted.

keys.description: Wipe all (default) app icons from the Dock. This is only really useful when setting up a new Mac, or if you don’t use.

keys.title: showLaunchpadGestureEnabled

https://github.com/jneuendorf/AdvancedSe.name: Address Book, Dashboard, iCal, TextEdit, and Disk Utility

keys.title: ABShowDebugMenu
keys.description: Enable the debug menu in Address Book.

keys.description: Enable Dashboard dev mode (allows keeping widgets on the desktop).

keys.description: Enable the debug menu in iCal (pre-10.8).

keys.description: Open and save files as UTF-8 in TextEdit.

keys.description: Auto-play videos when opened with QuickTime Player.

keys.description: Enable the WebKit Developer Tools in the Mac App Store.

keys.title: ShowDebugMenu
keys.description: Enable Debug Menu in the Mac App Store.

keys.title: AutomaticCheckEnabled
keys.description: Enable the automatic update check.

keys.title: ScheduleFrequency
keys.description: Check for software updates daily, not just once per week.

keys.title: AutomaticDownload
keys.description: Download newly available updates in background.

keys.title: CriticalUpdateInstall
keys.description: Install System data files & security updates.

keys.title: AutoUpdate
keys.description: Turn on app auto-update.

keys.title: AutoUpdateRestartRequired
keys.description: Allow the App Store to reboot machine on macOS updates.

keys.title: disableHotPlug
keys.description: Prevent Photos from opening automatically when devices are plugged in.

keys.title: Exclusions
keys.description: Disable Spotlight indexing for any volume that gets mounted and has not yet been indexed before. Use sudo mdutil -i off "/Volumes/foo" to stop indexing any volume.
